column4: G'day world - updated to 9.04 jaunty last week and i do not have any sound on my firefox browser
do you mean you don't get any sound with flash content or everything?
basically everything - even the start up sound does not work
you mean you don't have sound system wide? i thought it was just firefox
it was everything - but i can listen to files from my folders now, but i cannot hear anything whilst using the browser
sorry, haven't encountered that.
- i went into system - sounds and changed everything to OSS to recieve sound from my files, but , not sure what i have to do to recieve sound through the browser
never used oss so i don't know how to get that working.
irpty seems to be working in everything except ncmpc so I guess I'll have to start looking at that.
no worries DefineByte .. i think it might have something to do with flash maybe...thanks anyway.
is it was back in the hardy days I'd say install libflashsupport but everything's supposed to "just work" now. xD
if it was/
ok..will i obtain libflashsupport from my packet manager?
no, because it only works with hardy afaik
we are going back a bit
so the only option i can see is reloading hardy then..
- i might put up with it for a while and if i can't rectify it i might resort back to hardy.. Thanks for your input.
i'm sure it can be made to work with pulse/alsa, you just need to ask the right people. tried on the forums?
- that was my next mission
- Good News, just found a forum and fixed it, all is good..
fyi i managed to fix the problem. i rebooted...I know, but it's a sin to reboot in Linux, right? >.< Seems like it got stuck while running mpd --create-db.
excellent news. what was the fix?
- it had to do with libsound and pulse audio..it was an easy fix
